isis.stitle: 7.3 Liter Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1991) - DIAGNOSTIC ANALYSIS - DIAGNOSTIC ANALYSIS PROCEDURES FOR

svcproc.title: ...OIL CONSUMPTION
svcproc.para: When analyzing a lube oil consumption problem proceed as follows:

step1.para: Visually inspect for external leaks and correct.
Check for air cleaner restriction, air induction system leaks and excessive crankcase pressure.

svcproc.para: If items 1 and 2 are NOT the cause, continue analysis.

step2.para: Change the oil (using the recommended API Specification and viscosity for the ambient temperature). See NOTE.
Determine initial oil consumption rate and trend at:
Record the amount of make up lube oil added during the test period.

item.para: Verify the engine is equipped with the proper dipstick. A wrong dipstick may result in erroneous readings.
Lube oil level must be "topped" (with engine hot, after a 15 minute shutdown period), at the beginning and at the end of each oil consumption test period.

step1.para: If oil consumption was excessive, determine the cause of the problem.

step2.para: Abnormally heavy loads pulled by the vehicle. (Above the specified GVW).
Improper operation (i.e. allowing the engine to operate in the incorrect gear range) resulting in oil consumption.
Plugged air cleaner element causes high intake vacuum which will pull over oil through the crankcase ventilation hose(s).
Faulty air compressor. (If compressor piston rings are worn, oil can leak into the air system).
Worn engine valve guides. (Clean, inspect and replace if required).
Worn rings and/or bores due to dirt passing air cleaner or normal wear.
